Description: A terracotta whistle, still working, roughly in the shape of an animal's head. Part of it, but probably not much, is broken away. Hand-modelled. Pale-buff marl ware.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. No source given, but this is no doubt the one that is described in Petrie et al. 1888: 74, as having been found by him at Tell el-Yehudiya and 'perhaps modern'. Very near registration no. GR 1906,0301.7. Perhaps Saite Period, sixth century BC. Bibliog: Petrie 1885: 27; Petrie et al. 1888: 74; Favard-Meeks 1998: 106.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3702)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.57)
